questions.text: People who arrive more than 30 minutes ____ the opera begins should wait in the lobby until the doors to the main hall are opened.
First-class seats ____ with a fully reclining seat, workstation, TV, and a global telephone for the convenience of Turkey Airline's passengers.
Attendees of the conference who wish to stay near the venue are ____ to book their hotel early.
Additionally, we will be honoring ____ coupons during the sale.
...each customer will be strictly limited to ____ a maximum of five pairs of discounted shoes.
If this limit is surpassed, regular prices will apply for the remaining purchases. ____ We thank you in advance for your cooperation in making this sale accessible for all.
choices: A) Although our products are slightly used, we redecorate them as necessary.
B) We are affiliated with many smaller shoe stores in the area.
C) If this limit is surpassed, regular prices will apply for the remaining purchases.
D) Our website is currently being updated to reflect these prices.
questions.correctAnswer: C) If this limit is surpassed, regular prices will apply for the remaining purchases.

questions.text: Remember to take advantage of this weekend of great deals, ____ your next favorite pair of shoes is waiting for you right here at Gordon's!
What job is the vacancy closest to in terms of the duties involved?
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct answer is 'C) An administrative assistant' because the job involves duties typical of administrative support, such as guiding clients, managing schedules, and providing customer service.

questions.text: What qualification is NOT mentioned as a requirement for the job?
choices: B) Skill in handling electronic documents
C) An ability to deal with customers
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct answer is 'D) Written communication skills.' The advertisement specifically requires a degree, customer service ability, and document handling skills, but does not explicitly mention written communication skills.

questions.text: Why is the order late?
choices: A) The payment has still not been received
B) The firm has used an inaccurate mailing address
C) The government has imposed sanctions on shipping
D) Unexpected circumstances have affected the delivery
questions.correctAnswer: D) Unexpected circumstances have affected the delivery
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct answer is 'D) Unexpected circumstances have affected the delivery.' The email specifies that a wildfire and resulting road closures are the reason for the delay.

questions.text: Listening: Photographs
questions.teacherCorrection: The woman is facing the monitor.

questions.text: Listening: Question-Response
questions.teacherCorrection: At least 50 people, the questions expects a number of people that will be coming in teh future.

questions.text: What are the man and woman mainly discussing?
questions.teacherCorrection: The subject of the conversation is a conference that they are attending

questions.text: How is the woman traveling?
questions.teacherCorrection: The woman is travelling by bus.

questions.text: Why aren't the man and woman going together?
choices: A) The woman needs to arrive earlier.
B) The man has to work overtime.
C) The man has to work overtime.
D) The man has to go to the bank first.
questions.correctAnswer: C) The woman dislikes air travel.
questions.teacherCorrection: She is afraid of flying.

questions.text: What does the speaker say about the repair?
choices: B) It has been finished early.
D) It is covered by a warranty.
questions.correctAnswer: B) It has been finished early.
questions.teacherCorrection: The repair has been completed ahead of schedule.

questions.text: When can the listener pick up his car?
questions.teacherCorrection: They are closing for the day so he can come pick up his car anytime tomorrow

questions.text: What does the speaker offer to do?
choices: A) Look for a used part
B) Refund the cost of a charge
questions.teacherCorrection: He can arrange a ride for the customer to come to the repair shop.

questions.text: The computer systems ____ are affordable for a Fortune 500 company will not be affordable for a small company.
Sky Tower ____ the AV building is going to house the new regional office of Jacob and Associates.
Over one-third of the survey participants ____ the city's garbage collection fees too high.
In case you have not already noticed, a new scanner was installed in the main conference room last week. ______.
choices: A) As you all know, the old device was quite slow and difficult to use
B) Different types of paper are included with the device
C) Please reply with your preferred meeting time
D) Please allow us a few days to submit our final offer
questions.correctAnswer: A) As you all know, the old device was quite slow and difficult to use
questions.teacherCorrection: Option A) provides context for the introduction of a new scanner, giving a reason for its replacement - the old one was slow and difficult to use. The other options are not related to the context of introducing a new scanner.

questions.text: As such, we have invested in a wireless, highly-advanced model that we hope _____________ our company well over the next several years
questions.teacherCorrection: The structure 'hope + clause' is typically used with future simple, not present simple or present continuous. Therefore, 'we hope it will serve' is the appropriate structure.

questions.text: A helpful guide explaining general information and troubleshooting tips is _____________ on the table next to the scanner.
questions.teacherCorrection: The passive voice structure is used here to describe the position of the guide. 'Is located' means the guide can be found at a certain place, which in this context is on the table next to the scanner.

questions.text: Please _________ it if you have any questions while learning how to use the new device.
questions.teacherCorrection: In the context of the sentence, the action that one should do with the guide when having questions is to 'reference' it, meaning to consult or look into it. The other options don't fit contextually since you wouldn't 'notify' a guide, 'discuss' it in this scenario, or 'explain' it.

questions.text: For whom is the invitation most likely intended?
questions.teacherCorrection: Residents of the town - The text mentions that the Richmond community is invited to the anniversary celebration.

questions.text: What is being announced?
choices: A) The commemoration of a community
B) The commemoration of an institute's founding
C) The annual gathering of students in a field
D) The opening of a city's historical exhibit
questions.correctAnswer: B) The commemoration of an institute's founding
questions.teacherCorrection: The commemoration of an institute's founding - The text mentions that the celebration is in celebration of 40 years of academic excellence at Langara University.

questions.text: What is indicated about the events and activities
choices: A) They are all free for participants
B) The community members organized them
C) They will take place at various locations around Richmond
D) They will last for five days
questions.correctAnswer: C) They will take place at various locations around Richmond
questions.teacherCorrection: They will take place at various locations around Richmond - The text mentions that events and activities will be available for the town's amusement and will be held at various locations including the Central Hall, the Langara building, Richmond Field, the sports field, and the Richmond field.

questions.text: Listening: Photographs
questions.teacherCorrection: The drum is in front of the chair.

questions.text: Listening: Question-Response
questions.teacherCorrection: He's probably too busy today. An opinion is expected

questions.text: What does the man have to do today?
questions.teacherCorrection: The man has a doctor's appointment this afteroon.

questions.text: What can be inferred from the conversation?
choices: A) The woman is the man's receptionist.
B) The lawyer works in the same building.
C) The woman has no deadlines today.
D) The man and woman have a meeting this afternoon.
questions.correctAnswer: C) The woman has no deadlines today.
questions.teacherCorrection: She has no deadlines today and can handle some of the man's work.

questions.text: What does the woman offer to do for the man?
choices: D) Take notes at the meeting
questions.teacherCorrection: She will answer his calls.

questions.text: What kind of business does the speaker work for?
questions.teacherCorrection: She is talking about serving food, so the speaker works for a restaurant.

questions.text: Why does the speaker assign extra work to the listeners?
choices: B) A staff member is unwell.
D) Equipment needs to be unpacked.
questions.correctAnswer: B) A staff member is unwell.
questions.teacherCorrection: Another staff has a cold, so the listeners have to do extra work.

questions.text: What does the speaker ask listeners to tell customers about?
questions.teacherCorrection: To tell the customers about the new menu they have.

questions.text: The supervisor reminds the staff that ____ is discussed at the meeting is confidential and should not be revealed to anyone who is not in the company.
____ your application be denied, you will receive a full refund of the application fee.
A snowstorm ____ by freezing rain has been forecast in the Midwest on Sunday evening.
Museum employees are eligible to ______ this series, which will culminate in a guided tour of a number of Renaissance masterpieces in the McKellen Gallery.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct answer is 'B) attend'. This choice correctly completes the sentence by stating that employees can attend the series of lectures.

questions.text: There is no charge for museum staff, but all participants must register in advance, as there is ______ seating.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct answer is 'C) limited'. 'Limited' fits properly to describe the availability of seating, indicating that it is not unlimited.

questions.text: Stop by my office to sign up today for this ______ chance to hear Dr. Byers speak.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct answer is 'A) exceptional'. This word describes the unique or special opportunity to hear Dr. Byers speak.

questions.text: This is an opportunity you will not want to ______.
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct answer is 'D) miss'. This phrase completes the sentence by suggesting it's an opportunity too good to forego.

questions.text: What kind of business do Ms. Lambert and Mr McDonald probably work for??
questions.teacherCorrection: An apparel company - This is mentioned in the text: 'We should prepare for the increased demand and come up with new clever designs for the formal and casual wear we produce.' (Paragraph 6)

questions.text: At 12:28 P.M., what does Mr. McDonald most likely emphasize when he says “indeed”?
choices: A) That the customer service center is fully staffed
B) That the company must be ready for new customers
C) That there are enough specialists for the region
D) That the brand must carefully consider its next step
questions.correctAnswer: B) That the company must be ready for new customers
questions.teacherCorrection: That the company must be ready for new customers - This is mentioned in the text: 'The next step for our brand is to adjust to the next wave of incoming customers...We should prepare for the increased demand and come up with new clever designs for the formal and casual wear we produce.' (Paragraphs 5 and 6 )

questions.text: What will Mr. Thompson receive?
choices: A) A full refund of the price of the order
B) Free shipping on several orders in the future
C) Coupons for the next three orders
D) A free replacement for the items ordered
questions.correctAnswer: B) Free shipping on several orders in the future
questions.teacherCorrection: The correct answer is 'B) Free shipping on several orders in the future.' According to the email, Mr. Thompson's current order and the next three orders will have free shipping as a gesture of goodwill for the delay caused by external circumstances.

questions.text: Listening: Photographs
questions.teacherCorrection: The drum is in front of the chair.

questions.text: Listening: Question-Response
questions.teacherCorrection: No, I sent it by email. A yes or no answer is expected here.

questions.text: Why is the woman calling?
choices: B) To complain about a product
C) To redeem a gift card
questions.correctAnswer: B) To complain about a product
questions.teacherCorrection: She is calling because the coffee machine she recently bough stopped working.

questions.text: What does the man ask the woman about?
questions.teacherCorrection: He asks when the woman bought the coffee machine to know if the warranty is still valid

questions.text: What does the man offer to do?
questions.teacherCorrection: As she is a valued customer, he can offer a coupon for 40% off her next purchase.

questions.text: What bothers the man about Torland Advertising?
choices: A) Their failure to meet deadlines
C) Their request to revise a contract
D) Their focus on cost cutting
questions.correctAnswer: D) Their focus on cost cutting
questions.teacherCorrection: They seem to be much more concerned about cutting their cost than they are looking to give good quality advertising.

questions.text: What does the man mean when he says, 'Here’s the thing'?
choices: A) He will demonstrate a product.
B) He has forgotten a word.
C) He has found what he was looking for.
D) He will introduce a point to consider.
questions.correctAnswer: D) He will introduce a point to consider.
questions.teacherCorrection: He is about to introduce a point to consider.

questions.text: What are the listeners asked to look at?
questions.teacherCorrection: 'Please take a moment to look at the contract with me'

questions.text: ____ the possible coming retaliation in the trade war, the country decided to seize the initiatives and form stronger bonds with neighboring countries.
The landlord insisted that the tenants ____ until the end of the month to abide by the contract.
Two years ago, the Department of Computer Science at the University of British Columbia began ____ artificial intelligence courses.
If you _____ before July 21, we will add one extra month to your subscription.
There is no charge for museum staff, but all participants must register in advance, as there is _____ seating.
You do not need to enclose your _____ at this time. We will send you an invoice, and you can send your money later.
So mail the card today. You will not miss a _____ copy of Financial News Weekly, and you will receive an extra month for free!
What piece of information is incorrect in the reservation?
choices: B) The list of available facilities
D) The date the conference begins
questions.teacherCorrection: The arrival date - 'To clarify, you mentioned that I would arrive on September 8, which is incorrect. Though the conference begins on September 8, I will arrive two days earlier, on September 6.' (Second email, Paragraph 2)

questions.text: What can be inferred about the Tiempos Relajantes bar?
choices: A) It is available to everyone
B) It is reserved for conference participants
C) It requires a VIP access
D) It is next to the Oriental Delights restaurant
questions.correctAnswer: A) It is available to everyone
questions.teacherCorrection: It is available to everyone - The text does not mention any restrictions on the use of the Tiempos Relajantes bar, implying that it is available to all guests of the hotel. The text mentions that the bar is located at the entrance of the hotel: 'we also have the Oriental Delights restaurant on the roof and the Tiempos Relajantes bar at the entrance.' (First email, Paragraph 2)

questions.text: What is NOT specified in the first email?
choices: A) Mr Smith will enjoy a 30% discount on his reservation
B) Mr Smith is expected to arrive on September 8
C) The Oriental Delights is a rooftop resetaurant
D) The hotel is a sponsor for the conference
questions.correctAnswer: D) The hotel is a sponsor for the conference
questions.teacherCorrection: The hotel is a sponsor for the conference - This information is not mentioned in the first email.

questions.text: Listening: Photographs
questions.teacherCorrection: He is shoveling some soil.

questions.text: Listening: Question-Response
questions.teacherCorrection: Did you have to wait very long? -> No more than an hour. Here, 'No' is not in the negative form. 'No more than an hour' means 'a maximum of 1 hour'.

questions.text: Where do the speakers work?
questions.teacherCorrection: They both work at the hotel

questions.text: What does the man ask about?
choices: A) How many people have applied for a promotion
B) If a manager is in the lobby
C) Whether a position is available
D) When new shifts will be assigned
questions.correctAnswer: C) Whether a position is available
questions.teacherCorrection: He asks the woman if she know whether the hotel is still taking applications for the job or not.

questions.text: What does the woman say the man should be prepared to do?
choices: C) Get to know local clients
questions.teacherCorrection: She says that if he does not mind wroking the evening hours, he could have a good chance at getting the job.

questions.text: 80 Where most likely is the speaker?
questions.teacherCorrection: They speaker says 'we are happy to see you all at the seminar this afternoon.'

questions.text: What are listeners asked to do?
choices: A) Stay seated during the break
B) Carry their valuables with them
D) Share printed programs with others
questions.correctAnswer: B) Carry their valuables with them
questions.teacherCorrection: Keep money, phones and other eletronic devices with you

questions.text: Look at the graphic. Who will be the final presenter?
questions.teacherCorrection: There will be a change with the two presenters, which means that Mr. Chambers will chance schedule with Mr. Ohta.
